Name: Universal Rule: Magnitude
Description:
This expansion is included in the base game set Universal Rule: Second Wave.


A 6-card expansion to the Universal Rule family of games. This expansion adds 6 new planets to explore that adds additional rules and ways to score.

The main theme of this expansion is cards that make things bigger.


Planets:

     Sietynas
     Innollica
     Kothar
     Galvacil
     Pharamme
     Outis



Released in the September 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: Normandy '44 – Red Devils of the Orne
Description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Normandy '44 - Red Devils of the Orne

This is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the the fighting of the paratroops from the 9th Parachute Battalion (British) and 1st Canadian Parachute Battalions, 6th Airborne Division east of the Orne River in early June 1944.

The book includes twelve scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of three campaigns.

This book is fully compatible with the other four books in the SkirmishCampaigns Normandy series (First Hours, Heroes of Omaha and Panzer Lehr and Monty's EPSOM).

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information and a map on the campaign east of the Orne River. This book also features an annotated bibliography of sources.

Includes:

     12 Scenarios,
     3 Campaigns


—description from the publisher

Name: Banned Books: Lennie
Description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Of Mice and Men by John Steinbeck, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club February 2018 package.

Lennie:
(1) Forget: Take the action of any face down card.
(2) Strength: Roll the die. If you roll a 1, 2, or 3 you may stall all of the powers. Nothing happens if you roll a 4, 5, or 6.

Name: Banned Books: Bernard
Description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Brave New World by Aldous Huxley, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club October 2018 package.

Bernard:
(1) Rise: Move a power token and a progress token each forward two spaces.
(2) Fall: Move a progress token back 2 spaces and another forward 2 spaces.

Name: Banned Books: Guy
Description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club August 2018 package.

Guy:
(1) Pride: Take the lane 1 action three times, then move it to the end and flip it over.
(3) Burn: Lose up to 3 stamina to progress one space for each stamina lost.

Name: Banned Books: Tom
Description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Grapes of Wrath by John Steinbeck, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club November 2018 package.

Tom:
(3) Parole: Restart your turn.
(3) Vitality: Place a stall token on your Stamina. At any point you can move it to a power.

Name: Banned Books: Atticus
Description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club September 2018 package.

Atticus:
(1) Represent: Take the action of a lane where a power is further than the progress.
(2) Equality: Move a progress token to the same space as a power token.

Name: Dwarf Invasion
Description:
A 9-Card microgame from Button Shy games for 1-3 players.

In a reversal of roles, the aliens are the ones being invaded! In Dwarf Invasion you will try to destroy the alien hive that was simply minding its own business, until you came along to rob them of their precious minerals. Watch out, as they will fight back!

Players will need to supply up to 12 6-sided dice.

Name: Tornado Chase
Description:
Become the best storm chaser and jockey for position while avoiding being swept away in the storm. Let the Veteran Driver get you in the storm's path so that the Anxious Radar Tech can drop weather sensors at just the right moment. Just be sure to get out of path of the infamous F5 tornado!

Tornado Chase is a 9-card microgame from Button Shy for 2-4 storm chasers.

Players try to score the most acclaim points before the Tornado reaches the final space.


Released in the June 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Micro Drift
Description:
Nanodaption of Turbo Drift.


Description by the designer:

Based on Turbo Drift by Rob Cramer, as part of the September 2017 "Boardgame of the Month."

Based on one of my earliest attempts at game design, Micro Drift has players swerving wildly around an arena to collect a set of four flags. Grab a boost or chevron and watch out for oil. After moving, you steer by rotating a quadrant of the board, which rearranges the paths and can force your opponents to head in different directions.

This comes with 4 two-sided cards and a rule sheet. Cut out the tokens and fold the Car standees to bring the game to life.

Name: Bread and Circuses
Description:
A 3-card microgame for exactly 3 Roman Nobles out for themselves in a time of crisis.

The great empire is crumbling.

Players are nobles doing what nobles do best in a crisis - milking the plebeians for as much money as possible before fleeing to their country homes. Make more money by giving plebeians a scarcer resource.

Consists of 3 cards. A scoring method (pen and paper) is needed and should be provided by the players.


Released in the October 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Lazer Battlefield
Description:
Two recruits face-off in a war tactics simulation, codenamed Mirror Battlefields.

These new tools will reflect lazers and allow new angles to reach the enemy.

But, as with any emerging warfare tech, we expect the enemy is working on their own version.

A 9-card microgame for 1-2 players (solo rules available), with 2 ship cards and 7 battlefield cards.


In this game, each player takes control of a ship skirting the outside of a battlefield grid. Initially, the grid is full of unknown cards, but as they are hit with your laser, they are revealed and can be moved to help you attack your opponent. First player to hit their opponent twice wins.

I've also added a Solo variant where a pesky drone is racing you around the battlefield. Can you destroy it before it gets home?

—description from the designer

Name: 3 Lands or King
Description:
A little game of conquest.
Two Houses against each other, one kingdom to conquer!

In this 8 card microgame, 2 players each vie to conquer three of the five lands, or become king (by conquering 2 lands with a total value of 18 or more). The first to do so wins.

Each land battle takes place as players add one of 5 army types to the land, then maneuvers them using their unique movement abilities to attempt to be first to get 3 armies in a row.

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: Poland '39 – The Black Brigade
Description:
Poland '39-The Black Brigade
On September 1, 1939 the German army invaded Poland and started the greatest war the earth had ever seen. Contrary to popular myth, the Polish army fought with determination and skill. Poland managed to hold out nearly as long against Germany as France and Britain did a year later.

This book traces the saga of the brave Polish 10th Mechanized Division, the "Black Brigade" from the opening days of invasion to the fall of Poland.

Elements of the intrepid Black Brigade eventually withdrew from Poland and formed the nucleous of the Polish 1st Armored Division that would in 1944 close the Falaise Gap and play a key role in the capture of thousands of German troops.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the Polish Campaign of 1939.

Includes: 

     10 Scenarios,
     4 Campaigns.


—description from the publisher

Name: Tsukuyumi: Full Moon Down – Dark Crusade
Description:
When the Marduk Order started their offensive against Tsukuyumi, the boldest and most renown knights of the Order were sent on the hardest mission in the history of the great battles against the wyrms: venture into the innerst of the moon and finish what the Kami Hunters began.

Whilst their brothers of the KG 03 were send to fight the Oni from the ground, the KG 01, were deployed directly on the moon 3000 kilometers above the ocean soil. From there, the 5 dragonslayers began their journey into the core of the moon.

Buried in the bodies of their fallen foes in their pierced battlesuits, the knights of the KG 01 were imbued with Tsukuyumi's power and became Oni. But due to their training and their faith they were able to resist the transformation and keep their own will. With their new powers they patched their battlesuits with organic mass and ascended from the inner core of the moon. Half Oni and half knight. Ready to rain havoc on whoever steps in the way of their crusade. Their DARK CRUSADE.

Playstyle

The Dark Crusade are immensely powerful. But like the KG 03 they only have few units. In fact they have even less units then their righteous brothers, namely three.

As the Dark Crusade are kind of Oni themselves they can to certain amount interact and even control the Oni.
All Oni adjacent to Grendel count as units of the Dark Crusade and can be moved by the player and can even perform attacks.

As long as Lilith is in play, areas with Oni in them can not be conquered and finally every area Samael enters gains the Tsukuyumi area property.

Oh, and I almost forgot Baal. But he just sits in his drop pod (The KG 01 homezone) and shoots everybody who comes near him.
Like the KG 03 the Dark Crusade wants to dictate the pace of the game right from the start and center the attention on the moon and areas that a worth more VP.

The Dark Crusade really are the new powerhouse in town.

Did I mention that Grendel has an atomic bomb for a heart?

No? And guess what, he can blow it up, inflicting tons of damage! Literally TOOOONS of damage.

So are you ready to expose yourselves to Tsukuyumi's pheromones and step inside a tainted battlesuit to bring wrath upon your opponents?

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: Gross Deutschland at Kursk
Description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Russia 43-Gross Deutschland at Kursk is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the German Gross Deutschland Division and its powerful drive on the southern flank of the Kursk salient in July 1943. This is the first in a set of two books focused on the titanic struggle around Kursk.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic variable order of battle for each scenario.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the German offensive at Kursk in 1943.

Includes:

     10 Scenarios,
     3 Campaigns 


—description from the publisher

Name: Larvapocalypse: Flesh Pit Expansion
Description:
The Flesh Pit Expansion features the 2" Immortal Flesh Pit Monster and a 4x4 Bloody Flesh board tile. The Immortal Monster awakens at the sound of combat and poses a deadly threat to any who enter the Flesh Pit.

This is the first Larvapocalypse expansion to feature new gameplay mechanics, and the Immortal Monster figure is the first 2" figure released for the game.

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: Russia '41 – Ghosts at Smolensk
Description:
SkirmishCampaigns:Russia 41-Ghosts at Smolensk is a complete book recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the German 7th Panzer "Ghost" Division and its titanic struggle around Smolensk in July 1941. This book is a partner to the previous release "France '40-The Ghost Division" as it features the same unit and is also the third book in a trilogy of books focused on the German invasion of Russia in 1941.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the German drive to Smolensk in July 1941.

Includes:

     10 Scenarios,
     4 Campaigns 


—description from the publisher

Name: Reggae Revolution
Description:
In the year 2266, the world is controlled by a facist police state.  Peace, love, unity, and respect have all been made illegal.  Finding the relics of reggae in the ruins of the old world, a circle of youths rediscovers the power of music.  They plan to coordinate an enormous underground dance party to return the message of nonviolent resistance back to the people.

Reggae Revolution is a cooperative card game for 1 to 6 players.

Players work together to bring the message of peace and love back to the world.  In the game are four suits: peace, love, unity, and respect.  Players try to use these cards to collect sets in the score area to win the game.  But, at the beginning of each player's turn, a villain card pops out and makes the player discards all cards of a suit that the villain supresses.  Instead of fighting the villains, the players must sway them by giving them cards from their deck.  If the player does not have enough, the villain stays in play.  As the villains stack up, the players must discard more and more cards from their hand.  If the villains ever supress all four suits, peace, love, unity, and respect, then no one has any cards and the villains win the game!

Fight the power!  Join the resistance!  And bring peace and love back to the people!

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: Russia '41 – Drive on Minsk
Description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Russia '41-Drive on Minsk is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the German invasion of Russia in late June 1941.

The book includes ten action-packed scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of three campaigns.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the Russian Campaign of 1941.

Includes:

     10 Scenarios,
     3 Campaigns


—description from the publisher

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: Russia '41 – North to Leningrad!
Description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Russia ’41-North to Leningrad! is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the opening days of fighting for Germany’s Army Group North in June 1941. The campaigns of the German 1st and 6th Panzer Divisions are followed in detail. The book includes twelve scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of four campaigns.

This book is fully compatible with the other three books in the SkirmishCampaigns Russia ’41 series (Minsk, Ukraine, and Smolensk).

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information and history on the campaign. This book also features a bibliography of sources.

Includes:

     12 Scenarios,
     4 Campaigns


—description from the publisher

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: Russia '41 – Into the Ukraine
Description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Russia '41-Into the Ukraine is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the armored clashes between German Panzer Divisions and Soviet Mechanized Corps in the invasion of the Ukraine in June-July 1941.

The book includes ten action-packed scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of three campaigns.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the Russian Campaign of 1941.

Includes:

     10 Scenarios,
     3 Campaigns


—description from the publisher

Name: Battle for the Island
Description:
Set on a golden island you must try to outsmart your opponent in a strategic battle that starts right from the very beginning

The island is set on a 12 x 12 playing field. Each player starts the game with one carrier pad and ten tiles which consist of three different characters. The tiles are also reversible, on one side you have your combat unit and the other side is a number that represents that characters firing range. You can choose either side of the tile to play your battle. Plus there’s ten communal obstacle block tiles.

Game play 
All characters move around the island in the same manner by the roll of a dice which is numbered 0-5. The number rolled on the dice will determine the amount of moves a character can advance to. You will have the option to move your character forward in a straight line, and the option to change direction to the left or right on each move. To remove your opponents characters from the island, your character has to be facing forward towards your intended target in a direct line, and the shot has to be an exact hit matching your characters fire range. An exciting part of the game is the fact that your carrier pad, not only carries your reinforcements but it can also, move along the edge of the island. Now your characters will be able to be launched onto the island from a different position.

Setup
The action starts as soon as you start setting up for the battle ahead.
First take turns in placing one obstacle block at a time onto the island until all ten tiles are on the island, during the battle these can be used for defence or can be activated for attack. Carry on taking turns until you have placed any five of your ten characters onto the island, at this stage you will be keeping a close eye on what your opponent is up to. Your remaining five characters will be placed onto your carrier pad of which is located just off the edge of the island, this is where your reinforcements are located during the battle.

PLAY YOUR TURN
After the setup play will now continue by the roll of the dice. 
This is where the action gets real on your turn you will have the option to remove any intended target, providing a direct hit has been established. This action can be done before you move your character and after and as many times as you wish. All movement is determined by the roll of the dice, after which many options will be available to you; move to attack, elude attack, blocking your enemy from movement, activating obstacle blocks, risk taking, launching reinforcements and moving your carrier pad. On your turn you must all ways make your play using the entire number shown on the dice. Failure to do this will result in you losing a character so play well and try not to get yourself trapped. When your happy with all your actions played, you will now pass play over to your opponent who in turn will play their turn.

Carry on taking turns until a player wins by removing all ten of his opponent's characters to become the new ruler.

-description from publisher

Name: Night Class: Episode Two
Description:
In this unique roll & write game, you become a superhero-in-training. Customize your hero each round, while infiltrating the enemy's location and neutralizing the threats. But hurry, time is ticking and you might not be able to save everyone!

Looks like the neighborhood has some new muscle in town. Led by a trigger-happy criminal known as Miss Never, the crooks have already ransacked two local banks. They messed up tonight, because class was cancelled, and your night just opened up.

Object of the Game: Defeat Miss Never, her right-hand man, Edge, and the ghostly villain Wraith. You must also recover all of the stolen money. You lose if you cross out your last Stamina point, the public trust drops too low (all squares filled in), or Miss Never escapes.

Name: Night Class: Episode Three
Description:
In this unique roll & write game, you become a superhero-in-training. Customize your hero each round, while infiltrating the enemy's location and neutralizing the threats. But hurry, time is ticking and you might not be able to save everyone!

Dr. Killian Switch, the world-renowned engineer, had been missing for days, before returning with an army of robots. His demands were short and dark—surrender the city to his control or face annihilation at the hands of his minions. Well, former teacher or no, this professor needs to be dismissed. Now hopefully you can stop this madman, because a failing grade is the least of your concerns!

Object of the Game: Defeat Killian Switch, Nemetron and EVE-209. You lose if you cross out your last Stamina point, or the public’s Trust drops too low (all squares filled in).

Name: Drive Like Hell
Description:
Drive Like Hell was a finalist in Button Shy Game's September Challenge where all 18 cards were required to be identical!

With your recently rescued lover in tow, you now flee the minions of Hell, and the Devil himself. The creature from the pit will own your lover’s soul unless you can reach the sanctity and safety of Saint Joseph's Cathedral. So shift your car into high gear and Drive Like Hell!

Object of the Game: To win the game you must reach the Saint Joes location without The Devil reaching you, having your vehicle receive four points of damage or having a Fiend reach your location.
Families: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

Name: Big Easy Busking: French Quarter Expansion
Description: The French Quarter, mini expansion includes 3 new Song Ability cards so you can play the Mardi Gras variant in style! You must own the base game to use this expansion.
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Skirmish '90: Modern Wargames Rules 1915-2005
Description:
Rules designed to deal with small unit actions between 1915 and 1995. 
     Aimed at Platoon or company level with limited air and armour support.
     They use non-linear ground scale, varying from 1:400 at short distances to 1:2000 at the maximum envisaged distance. In effect accentuating the role of small-arms & other infantry weapons.
     Turns are simultaneous and in general the order set out in the Bound should be followed. 
     Reaction rolls are there to make the unit leaders the centre of the game.
     Allow hidden movements in the presence of an empire

Name: Gaugameles: Le jeu de simulation tactique au temps d'Alexandre Le Grand
Description:
Large scale tactical level Miniature Wargame rules in the times of Alexander the Great. in French

Minis: 28mm (recommended)

Règle de jeu pour reproduire les batailles de masse au temps d'Alexandre le Grand.
Families: History: Wars of Alexander the Great

Name: Marathon: Le Jeu de Simulation Tactique au Temps de la Grèce Antique
Description:
Large scale tactical level Miniature Wargame rules in Ancient Greece. in French

Minis: 28mm (recommended)

règle de jeu tactique avec figurines simulant les batailles de la Grèce antique.
Families: History: Greek & Persian conflicts of the 4th century BC

Name: Root: The Vagabond Pack
Description:
Upgrade your Root game with seven custom Vagabond meeples. Includes three new Vagabond character cards: Harrier, Ronin and Adventurer.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Hunters A.D. 2114: Shiptown
Description:
What secrets are hidden inside the wreck of the old tanker? What lurks in the darkness of holds and cabins sealed shut for decades?
—description from the publisher

Shiptown is a second expansion for The Hunters A.D. 2114.

Name: Torpor
Description:
The worst has occurred! While traveling through empty space in Cryonic Torpor, the PIN Drive responsible for Quantum Pinning your vessel to a point in time, allowing near instantaneous travel across light years, has failed. As a failsafe the ship has deactivated your Torpor, meaning you are slowly waking up with only moments to fix the drive and renew your Torpor before the low levels of life support on the ship  can no longer keep you conscious. You must Repair the Drive while manufacturing enough Refrigerant to renew Torpor, all while providing yourself with enough Oxygen and Nutrient to keep moving until you succeed.

Torpor is a single-player roll-and-write in which a player will assign up to five dice to various tasks on their board. Dice must be assigned to both Survival categories (Oxygen and Nutrient) every turn, and may also be assigned to buy Upgrades (such as an additional health or dice) and Repairs, which are needed to win the game. If you can repair both Refrigerant and Drive before running out of Health, you have won the game!

While rolling the dice you may reroll any dice in matching pairs, triples, etc. This provides strategy as you attempt to obtain the dice you will need each turn, and an element of risk as you may decide to reroll "good" dice in order to obtain the pairs you need to reroll "bad" dice. There is also strategy in deciding where to assign your dice, and when to intentionally take damage and work on repairs instead.

—description from the publisher

Name: Davy Jones' Locker
Description:
A VP-collection game with a unique moving-target mechanic that provides a good amount of player interaction, a bit of take-that and just the right amount of luck.
Each player controls two ships: The pirate ship can bury treasure, which becomes a target for other players to dig out, and can attack other ships to steal from them. The sailing ship must move onto landmarks on the board using limited movement dictated by a “wind” die, while being also a target for attacks.
Both the treasure and the actions players can use come from chits drawn from a bag throughout the game.
You win by having the most points in hand, buried under your treasure markers on the board, or from collected landmarks.
The game can be played from 2 to up to 6 players.

—description from the publisher

AWARDS
Finalist in the 2020 Geekway to the West game design contest (convention/contest cancelled).

Name: Alpina
Description:
Each player has a tourist and a party of 3 guides and 7 shooters. There is also a poacher and a stage coach for each player. The goal of the game is for the tourists to reach one of two summits in enemy territory. The task of the party is to help their own tourist and prevent the opponent tourist to reach his goal.

The different game pieces have different methods to move or to take prisoners:

Tourist: move and take: 1 step in any direction. If the Tourist is threatened, he may take the place of one of his guides or shooters 1 step away from him. The guide or shooter is eliminated from the game.

Guide: moves 1 or 2 steps in any direction, takes 1 step from mountain to valley or vice-versa.

Shooter: moves 1 step in any direction, takes 1 step from mountain to valley.

Poacher: moves 2 or 3 steps in any direction, may take only 1 shooter (per game!) 1 step in any direction, may ot use the coach.

Stage Coach: moves up to 3 steps on the red roads and takes all enemy pieces on the way if they are not standing directly behind each other. May transport friendly pieces up to 2 steps.

—user summary

Name: Blood Rage: Mystic Troll
Description:
This was a Kickstarter Exclusive Stretch Goal to the original KS (2015) and has been available at conventions and other various sales by CMON.
It was also available in the Promos Box during the Digital KS (2018) as a resculpt and renamed (Seer Troll)

Name: Unearthed
Description:
A three-dimensional treasure hunt on an multi-layered island.
Lasercut with magnetic tiles to hold tools and secret artifacts.

Dig through the several layers to uncover artifacts needed to recover treasures:

     terrain
     tools
     strata.


Uncover tools needed to dig deeper.

Terrain includes fields, forest, rocks, ruins and swamps.

Somewhat akin to the Treasure of Oak Island.

—description from the designer

Name: The Silent Battalion: Enemy Pack 2 – Five Leagues from the Borderlands
Description:
In the dark of night, the Silent Battalion marches to reclaim the world from the living.

This Enemy Pack for Five Leagues From the Borderlands slots right into any campaign and offers:

     A new Enemy type featuring skeleton soldiers with 8 entries.
     Rules explaining the new Enemy type, how fighting them works and any game changes needed.
     5 new Personalities to do battle with.
     3 new Skills to obtain.


Whether you are looking for some variation, something new to paint or a chance to use some skeletons on the table, this expansion pack has what you need.

For the Five Leagues 2nd edition rule set.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Five Leagues From the Borderland

Name: Roads Well Traveled: An Expansion Pack for Five Leagues from the Borderlands
Description:
This expansion for Five Leagues From the Borderlands dramatically expands the Roadside Encounters mechanic in the core rules.

The worlds of fantasy tales are always filled with interesting, memorable and occasionally dangerous travelers and our campaign games should be no different.

The existing tables have been expanded to include new results, allowing for more variety and more things the person might want from you.

Some existing results have been tweaked to be more interesting as well.

Players have remarked positively on the ability to make Friends with travelers, but they haven’t been that easy to get an advantage from.

We’ve updated that system to make it a bit more helpful to the player.

There are also more opportunities to have roadside encounters now.

Most excitingly this pack adds 30 unique encounters ranging from a treasure hunter joining you for a bit to the local drunkard wanting someone to hang out with.

These new encounters can grant you rewards, new problems to deal with or a welcome respite fro the merciless world.

Some are simply events that happen, while others give you decisions to make.

The new rules, updated tables and unique encounters are all integrated into the new encounter table, allowing you to take full advantage of this pack.

Players who have their rules printed in a binder can simply replace the Roadside Encounter check pages in the rulebook with the pages from this supplement.

The pack is written for the 2nd edition rules, though it should be usable with 1st edition with very little adjustment.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Five Leagues From the Borderland

Name: Inventures
Description:
Inventures, Birtle Game’s first title, is a collaborative storytelling adventure game coming soon to Kickstarter.

In each game, players create their own characters and go on challenging adventures together. Victory comes down to how well you know your character and fellow players.

In Inventures, there’re no dice, game master, or numbers to track. Instead, Inventures relies on a powerful and novel game mechanic involving symbol interpretation.

When your character faces a challenge, you choose between options, each composed of a randomly drawn ACTION and OBJECT card.

You secretly pick which option best represents how your character would solve the problem. If the other players successfully guess which option you chose, your action succeeds and the story progresses.

Because of its modular symbol interpretation system, you can use Inventures to play stories in any setting imaginable: Westerns, SciFi, Fantasy, or a game set in the world of your favorite books or movies!

Games can be as short as 45 minutes and as long as weeklong campaigns.

—description from the designer

Name: Monopoly: Bob's Burgers
Description: It's Monopoly with a "Bob's Burgers" twist! Same as original Monopoly, with all of the board spaces, cards, and tokens done over in a Bob's Burgers theme. Includes 6 collectible pewter tokens.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Undead Samurai Rider
Description:
A promo card from the Kickstarter of Shadowvale and available in conventions.

Undead Samurai Rider is the Warden for the Undead Samurai Monster set (exp. pack 2)

3 magic and 3 strength to Slay
Reward: Flip a Citizen from another player
VP : 3 Victory Points

Name: Game of Thrones Trivia Game: Seasons 5-8 Expansion
Description:
Complete your battle for the Iron Throne with the Game of Thrones: The Trivia Game Season 5-8 Expansion! In the only game that matters, knowledge can be deadlier than a sword, and now the battle intensifies with the addition of a fifth player and over 1,200 new questions to test your wits. As you struggle to gain control of key locations, forge alliances, and earn favor, a sharp mind will mean the difference between victory and defeat. Put your knowledge to the test and claim your throne!

—description from the publisher

Name: Alphabet Dungeon
Description:
Alphabet Dungeon is a two to four player game where a group of stalwart adventurers go on a quest for treasure tiles.  You will be exploring a mysterious dungeon, fighting monsters and searching for treasure tiles.  In this dungeon the treasures are letters and your goal is to solve all the words on your quest.  As you explore the dungeon and defeat monsters you gain more letters to help solve more words.  The player that completes his/her entire quest of words wins the game.  During your exploration you can visit the bazaar and purchase vowels to help you complete your quest.

VICTORY CONDITIONS:
When a player completes all the quest words on his/her quest card, they win the game.  The Bonus word is used in case of a tie where both players complete their quest card on the same turn, the player that has also completed the bonus word would end up being the winner.  If both players complete all words and the bonus word on the same turn, then both players share the win.

-description from designer

Name: Master of Wills: Overlord Game Variant
Description:
The Overlord Master of Wills game variant is a mind-bending experience where the control of your fate no longer resides in your hands. This thrilling new experience forces all players into uncomfortable situations which require a different style of strategy to navigate. The Overlord has taken the City of Novus by storm… can you defeat your opponent while fending off this new unstoppable force?

The Overlord deck comes with 20 Overlord cards and 1 Help/Rule card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Master of Wills: Core Faction Expansion Set
Description:
This expansion set brings new Action, Epic and Legendary cards to each of the 4 core Factions. Expanding the Factions with new options provides exciting and unique power combinations that are not available in the base game. How will you utilize these different characters and abilities to crush your opponents?

—description from the publisher

Name: Restaurounds
Description:
In Restaurounds each player owns their own small sushi restaurant. Players compete to buy better equipment, hire skilled chefs and fulfill orders.

On their turn players move one of their chef meeples around their personal rondel, activate a tile and perform the action(s) printed on it.

Players can upgrade their rondel by buying new tiles from a central market which gives them more options and efficiency.

Players also have access to powerful one-time actions that can be very beneficial in the right moment.

—description from the publisher

Name: Master of Wills: Alphaguard Fringe War Neutral Pack
Description:
The world has split into four core Factions. As influence shifts, new fringe Factions have jointed the war with intentionss of changing the tide. Advanced technologies have emerged causing a major rise in conflict. Alphagurard is fortifying their ranks and will seek out these new inovations to preserve authority.

12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

—description from the publisher

Name: Master of Wills: Razorcorp Fringe War Neutral Pack
Description:
The world has split into four core Factions. As influence shifts, new fringe Factions have joined the war with intentions of changing the tide. Advanced technologies have emerged causing a major rise in conflict. Razorcorp has been on the cutting edge of these new developments, giving them a path towards world domination.

12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

—description from the publisher

Name: Master of Wills: Shadowcell Fringe War Neutral Pack
Description:
The world has split into four core Factions. As influence shifts new fringe Factions have joined the war with intentions of changing the tide. Advanced technologies have emerged causing a major rise in conflict. Shadowcell has been ilently hunting for this knowledge that would help them inflict extensive damage on their enemies.

12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

—description from the publisher

Name: Master of Wills: Dawnlight Fringe War Neutral Pack
Description:
The world has split into four core Factions. As influence shifts, new fringe Factions have jointed the war with intentionss of changing the tide. Advanced technologies have emerged causing a major rise in conflict. Dawnlight believes that a cosmic reckoning has come and is preparing for the gathering storm.

12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

—description from the publisher

Name: Master of Wills: Cloudecho Fringe War Neutral Pack
Description:
The world of chaos has bled over into all streams of life. Influence continues to shift from Faction to Faction with no end in sight. New powers have emerged that are shared between all Factions but how they are used is yet to be determined. Cloudecho is linking their collectiv consciousness with these new technologies, creating an advanced evolution.

12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

—description from the publisher

Name: Master of Wills: Edgehunter Fringe War Neutral Pack
Description:
The world of chaos has bled over into all streams of life. Influence continues to shift from Faction to Faction with no end in sight. New powers have emerged that are shared between all Factions but how they are used is yet to be determined. Combining these technologies with their elemental powers Edgehunter can strike and take back their place in the world.

12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

—description from the publisher

Name: Master of Wills: Bloodcrown Fringe War Neutral Pack
Description:
The world of chaos has bled over into all streams of life. Influence continues to shift from Faction to Faction with no end in sight. New powers have emerged that are shared between all Factions but how they are used is yet to be determined. Utilize this new tech will allow Bloodcrown to tighten their rule over the city even further.

12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

—description from the publisher

Name: Arvaa, mitä ajattelen?!
Description:
Players pick two cards, adjective and noun, and try to figure out third,suitable word for both of these words. If two players come up with the same word, both get points.

—user summary

Name: Roskis: Soptunnan
Description:
Players must open the lid of the garbage can, put in the garbage and try not to let the flies escape. The Garbage can vibrates and throws out those light flies. Game is over when all the flies have escaped. Winner is the one who let least numbers of flies escape.

—user summary

Not to be confused with the Lautapelit.fi Finnish edition of Mountain 53, which came out the same year with the same name.

Name: Hooch Stooges: Origins of Don Promo Card
Description: A promo card given away at conventions. “Until the end of turn, if you would get busted, draw a card instead.”

Name: Beach Life
Description:
While building a giant sandcastle, you notice that you are sharing the beach with a variety of sea-dwellers. You discard your bucket and space to give the creatures a helping hand. Get points for helping each animal, most points wins.

Beach Life is a 'roll and write' game. One player rolls the dice and each player decides how they will use the dice rolls on their own board. One dice determines which mini game you are working on, another determines the number you'll use within that game. The number on the third dice can be used five times in the game as a bonus action.

The game finishes when one player has taken three 'no throws'.

Beach Life is a 'Placemat' game - a game contained entirely within an A3 placemat (including the rules). Just add three standard D6 dice.

On the reverse side of each placemat is a second game - Castaway.

Both games have a desert island theme.

—description from the designer

Name: Castaway
Description:
You are stranded on a desert island. Use the resources at your disposal to make life more comfortable and/or increase your chances of rescue. Get points for developing your island. But will you try to make a home on this tropical paradise or do everything you can to get out of there?

Castaway is a 'roll and write' game. One player rolls the dice and each player decides how they will use the dice rolls on their own board. The dice show the coordinates on the map and indicate the area you must work on each turn. The choice of action within that area is yours. Will you cut down trees or plant new ones? Will you build a shelter or plunder a shipwreck? The choice is yours.

The game finishes when one player is rescued, abandoned or becomes self-sustained.

Castaway is a 'Placemat' game - a game contained entirely within an A3 placemat (including the rules). Just add two standard D6 dice.

On the reverse side of each placemat is a second game - Beach Life.

Both games have a desert island theme.

—description from the designer

Name: Tiny Epic Pirates: Curse of Amdiak
Description:
In Tiny Epic Pirates: Curse of Amdiak, rumors of the unthinkable are spreading quickly around the islands. Rumors of dead pirates returning to the sea... aboard an ominous ghost ship helmed by the legendary pirate Amdiak...

Several new game elements are added to play including cursed gold, a ghost ship that haunts the players as they try to steal the cursed gold, ancient relics, haunted map cards and even skeleton crew!

Players gain cursed gold by stealing it from the ghost ship and attacking other pirates who possess it. Cursed gold can be traded for an ancient relic said to hold ashes of Amdiak. Bury this relic and break the Curse of Amdiak!

If the ghost ship finds catches you though, your captain becomes cursed and you lose your cursed gold. Once cursed you will be able to recruit powerful skeleton crew to mindlessly obey your wicked command!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tsukiji: Special Cards
Description:
8 promo cards for Tsukiji, delivered as extras from Brazilian crowdfunding campaign and Argentinian preorders:


     Police officer (Keisatsu)
     Cat (Neko)
     Plunger (Suisoku)
     Refund (Modoru)
     Ice (Kori)
     Insomnia (Fumin-shoo)
     Rummage (Kichi)
     Pickpocket (Dorobo)

Name: Galaxia
Description:
Card game based on the solar system.
This a variant of the French Tarot. Like tarot, it could be played as a team with 4 or 5 player (teams change at each round). The player with the most points after some rounds, wins the game.

Translation from the back of the box:
"72 MAGNIFICENT CARDS, with colours and graphics, make up this completely original new game."

Name: צ'יקן (Chicken)
Description:
A variant of L.L.A.M.A.

Differences include:

     7 of each card instead of 8.
     Lower player count. 5 instead of 6.
     The game is over when a player reaches 50 points instead of 40.
     An additional single wild card. When played, it counts as 1 higher than the top card. When scoring, its value is equal to the last-played card.
     No tokens. Players must provide their own score-keeping method.
     Instead of returning tokens, a player who plays all their cards rolls two dice, which determine how many points are reduced from the score. The dice have the values 1,2,3,4,5,10. Your score can't go below 0.


—user summary

Name: Nemesis: Untold Stories #2
Description:
Untold Stories #2 provides several additional semi co-op game scenarios for Nemesis. They are presented in a graphic-novel/comic-book style, over 80+ full-color pages.


     80+ A5 pages
     10 script "triggering" cards
     A lot of additional gameplay.

Name: Vitoria 1813: The Battle for Spain – Six Wargame Scenarios for General d'Armee
Description:
Vitoria, 1813, The Battle for Spain is a scenario supplement for General d’Armee.  
Provides six iconic actions from decisive encounter at Vitoria in 1813, including

     The combat at Osma,
     the battle for the Puebla heights,
     the fight for the hill at Arinez,
     the battle for the Zadorra bridges,
     the fight for La Hermandad and
     the final assault on the main French position at Vitoria.


This 45 page PDF contains an illustrated historical introduction to the campaign followed by six scenarios which are easily printed out for the game you wish to play and contain complete army lists with unit and commander ratings as well as deployment notes and a breakdown of the terrain.  WHat’s more the six scenarios can be played individually or as part of a campaign, with the result of each scenario affecting the next.

If you are looking to game this iconic campaign that sealed the fate, and liberty, of Spain then look no further.

—description from the publisher

Name: Until the Frost Comes
Description:
Until the Frost Comes is a solo roll-and-write game of mapping your new domain of the Autumn Court.

You are the latest ruler of the Fairie Autumn Court, trying to build up your reputation by enchanting humans foolish enough to venture into your lands; protecting your borders against the Summer and Winter Courts with brambles; and decorating the land with pumpkins, apples, and festively colored leaves to make it feel autumnal.

Of course, not everyone in the Autumn Court wants you to succeed... Puck, Tricksters, Redcaps, Changelings, and the Wild Hunt all work against you, trying to ruin your plans!

During each of the 13 turns, roll 5 six-sided dice, consult the chart for rolls of singles, doubles, or triples going through the dice from lowest to highest, then choose any hex you'd like, and using a pencil draw what the chart says in that hex.  At the end of the game, tally each type of item you have drawn on the map to get your score.

—description from the designer

Name: Mythic Coins Card Game
Description:
Mythic Coins Card Gameis a player vs player game where you control a mythic character such as a God, Goddess, or other powerful being.  Each character comes in their own Coin Deck.

A Coin Deck contains a coin, display stand, dice, and 108 cards themed to that character.

There is no shuffling or drawing cards. Players use the cards to build their character based on their vision of that character and strategy for the game.  A character can be customized to various power levels in the areas of Attack, Defense, Damage Bonus, Resistance, Health, Power, and Ability Cards.

There are over 50 unique Ability cards.  Players secretly choose a set number of Ability cards before the game. These are kept in a player's hand and only shown when used.  Most Ability cards require a specific amount of Power cards.

During a player's turn, they can choose to Activate a Character, Rest a Character, or Use a Card. Most cards result in a battle with another character. Some cards have other effects.

A player must protect their Health cards and manage their Power cards while attacking and defending against an enemy.  Many attacks are resolved by opposing dice rolls. However, other attacks/defenses are countered by your opponent's cards.

There is no board. The coin is placed on its display stand in front of the player.  The cards are placed next to the coin.

There is no limit to the number of players.  You can play in teams, a handicapped game, or other game modes.

Game balance is maintained since each deck has cards with the same abilities.  However, they are themed to fit the character.  An evasion defense may be called Flight for a Dragon but Teleportation for a Lich.

Every card has a counter.  More powerful cards cost more to use.  You can only use an Ability card once.  These things prevent one or two cards from dominating the game.

When not playing, coins can be used as display pieces since they come with a stand.

—description from the designer

Name: Make Muster
Description:
This race to mutual connection / sudden death cut-off game, is based on an unusual forced-to-place vs free-to-move mechanism: - If you can place an unconnected piece, you must. Otherwise you move a piece toward achieving your goal.

You must balance finding ways to place enough pieces by opening up spaces, quickly making diagonal connections, and slowing down or cutting-off the opponent at the edges with tight connections; all the while not getting cut-off yourself.

Play is optimised for the jagged-edged Muster boards, in a choice of sizes:
 #2 short filler / bar game, 3-12 min
 #3 tactical filler game, 8 - 25 min
 #4 tactical strategy game, 15 - 45 min
 #5 abstract strategy game suitable for competitions, 25-90 min 
 #6 hard core 40 min++

There will be other games in this series using the Muster board, including Muster Up which is a simpler connection game with jumping moves.

Name: Verkaufshit
Description: The memo game for language lovers and wordsmiths. For 2 and more players. Playing time approx. 20 min. In the new memo game for language and pun lovers, pairs like "Bär" and "Tiger" result in the noun "BÄRTIGER". "Tang" and "Ente" become "TANGENTE", the nouns "Mode" and "Rat" form the German adjective "MODERAT". This game is full of surprises and trains the exact viewing of words. Each of the 36 pairs has its own background colour, which may be used as confirmation when searching for the correct word pairs. Only language grouches rely solely on the colours when searching for the pun pairs.

Name: Versteckt! Entdeckt?
Description:
Versteckt! Entdeckt? ("Hidden! Found?") is an associative memo game full of creative and affectionately arranged picture cards. This compact memo game transforms every-day objects into faces in no time at all – or, the other way around, challenges the players to discover the oftentimes well-hidden elements in the faces. Here, spaghetti turns into an impressive head of hair, a pancake takes the shape of a face, and a belly button suddenly becomes a mouth. Hidden! Found? is the smart successor of the MeterMorphosen memo game classic What is this?, where every-day items are transformed into different animals. The artist behind both games Antje Damm has written several philosophical children's books (i.e. Frag mich!, Nichts und wieder nichts) and has earned various prizes for them.

Also available with English sleeve.

Name: Was ist das?
Description: Discovering something special in every-day life and transforming it creatively – with the new memo game What is this? and a bit of skill anyone can achieve it. With motives by the renowned children's book illustrator Antje Damm, MeterMorphosen is finally introducing a memo game for children that is more challenging than the usual memo games as its pairs consist of two different motives. When you find everyday items like carrots, a clothespin or soap on the sturdy memo cards, the question is: What is this? With the matching second card, these every-day objects are transformed into animals: a sausage becomes a dachshund, and a popsicle unexpectedly turns into a penguin. The 24 pairs of What is this? promote associative thinking and thus support intelligence development through effortless play. This memo game is not only an assembly of marvellous ideas, but also an encouragement to examine the world more closely, to get creative and to use one's imagination.

Name: StadtSpiel
Description:
StadtSpiel ("CityGame") can be played as a classical domino, but you can also try to figure out the perfect urban layout in a puzzle variant. The game is constructive fun for young and old! Domino completely different new way - because imagination and creativity, a sense for the gap and the view are required for the matching puzzle piece.

The game keeps children and adults tied up for hours, because in this domino game new streets and buildings are constructed all the time and a constantly changing city brings great joy.

Name: Eierköppe
Description: An incredibly fun memo game for adults who are interested in the history of the 20th century. Just like in other memo games, the players have to find pairs – but actually, in this game there are always four of a kind! The four Beatles: John, Paul, George, and Ringo. Or four conservatives: Angela Merkel, Mother Teresa, Pope Jean Paul, and Margaret Thatcher. It is absolutely entertaining to spot the caricatures of prominent persons in the game and to discover their independent categorization. The players get to keep both cards if they find corresponding pairs, but if they find all four cards of a kind, they get additional points via an extra joker card that raises the pile of gained cards and helps them win the game in the end. There are 64 cards in the box.

Name: Arty Mouse: Drawing game
Description:
Arty Mouse: Drawing game was developed to help pre-school children learn colours and shapes. There are two ways to play - an easier and more advanced mode.

In the Basic game mode, every child gets their own wipe-clean board. Then a card with a drawing is chosen. The goal of the game is to be the first one to draw the same drawing with the same colours.

On their turn, a child reveals a card with a shape that determines the shape they can draw. They have to choose a colour and draw all the shapes in this colour exactly as on the card. The winner is the child who completes their drawing first.

In the Advanced game mode, a die determines the colour that the child has to use to draw a shape. But if the colour does not match the original, they get fewer points. They have to decide whether to pass a turn and wait for the perfect opportunity or to get at least some points before someone else finishes their drawing first.

The rules include additional variants for a cooperative and free drawing gameplay.

— description from the publisher

Name: Arty Mouse: Spin & Find game
Description:
Arty Mouse: Spin & Find game was developed to help children strengthen their memory and practice memory techniques. There are two ways of playing it - an easier and a more advanced mode.

The game has a spinner and tiles with characters. The characters are represented on the tiles multiple times in different environments and poses. The goal of the game is to find and get as many tiles as possible.

In the basic game mode, children first mark the back of the tiles. They can draw their unique markings, shapes and doodles that will help them remember what is on the other side. The tiles are then placed face-down. In the second part of the game they spin the spinner and find the character that the arrow points to among the face-down tiles. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game wins.

In the advanced game mode, extra tiles are added, with only some tiles marked, and additional rules apply that make the game even more challenging.

The rules include additional variants for a single player and cooperative gameplay.

—description from the publisher

Name: Yōkai: Tsurube Otoshi
Description:
Tsurube Otoshi is a goodie with rules for a new level for YÅkai.

It comes as a bottle opener and a rules card.

The Tsurube Otoshi sits on four cards that players cannot interact with on their turn. Once their turn is over, they move the Tsurube Otoshi to a new location for the next player to deal with.

Name: The 1967 Annual
Description: The 1967 Annual is a 64 page compendium of great new content for 7TV 2nd edition. This softback book features new articles, profiles, programme guides, the new Ratings War campaign rules and stories as well as 68 new profile cards, 12 ratings war cards and 4 new Daredevils gadgets.

Name: Boss Monster: Santa Epic Hero Promo
Description: Santa Claus was created as a promo during the Digital Boss Monster Kickstarter campaign. It was released on December 24th, 2014. It is the first Hero to have 9 base Health.

Name: A War of Whispers: Dark Alliances
Description: The Dark Alliances cards start the game in the deck with the other cards. You can use these powerful cards to help one of your fellow players...for a price!

Name: Book of the Dead
Description:
Book of the Dead is a fast-paced co-operative card game for 2-6 players that takes 9 minutes (or less) to play. Players must work together to collect the scattered pages, place them back into the book by matching arcane symbols and close the covers in time to prevent the return of Great Cthulhu.

At the start of each player's turn, they must roll the die of the dead, and then follow the instructions of the icon rolled before they take their action.  The Skull may force players to discard cards from their hand, and the Book may eject pages from the book, back to the vortex.   In the basic game, the Vortex icon is not used, and represents a brief respite for the players.

Each page of the book of the dead is represented by a double sided poker-sized card (with rounded corners) that feature 1-6 arcane icons.  To bring two pages together, the icons must match.  On your turn, after you have rolled the dice, you have one action, such as taking a card from the Vortex (the central pool of cards in the table), adding your 'stack' of cards to the book and finally, if able, to close the book and win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Comete
Description:
It's the St. Lorenz's night and as per tradition, people gather under a starry sky to see their wishes granted by the shooting stars. What most people don't know is that, in order to realize a particular wish, you need cunning and strategy. You will have to capture the right comets to make your dreams come true. But be careful: if you chase love you will hardly realize the desire for richness, the same its true for those who chase fame, at the expense of virtue... Plan your moves carefully, and avoid the traps of your opponent: who first realizes two wishes... wins the game!

Comete is a language-independent, highly thematic strategy game, which hides a fascinating and delicate depth of play.

Comete is a "perfect strategy" game, where all the information is known to all players and the resources available for each player are identical: your choices will make the difference. But it's not an abstract game, shooting stars are elusive and unpredictable, and so they are in the game. No one can know what will be the next fallen star to appear in the sky, even less when the comet you need will appear. Moreover, they exist as in the past comets harbingers of feast or famine and often it will be up to the player to decide how to unravel the celestial message.

To capture a comet you will have to «attract» it to you by matching its colours. You have several «wish fragments» (acrylic gems) to play each turn, which you must tactically place by line of the celestial horizon: if a comet passing next to them has the same colours, you have captured it!

—description from the publisher

Name: Autofarmer
Description:
Autofarmer is a competitive card game about growing cannabis. Players take on the roles of gardeners and try to grow as many grams as possible.

Firstly, players need to prepare their gardens. This is achieved by rolling dice. They define the number of seeds players get and the luck of their germination. Thanks to the dice the size of a garden is different in each game. Players must adapt their strategy to it.
The game consists of three rounds - growth, blooming, and harvest. Each turn players draw three cards from the deck. They can swap these new cards once. Then you play them to boost your plants or sabotage others.
But don’t get fooled, the task will be indeed daunting. Not only natural disasters like molds or pests, but mainly the malevolence of other players lurk here as only one of you can become the best grower!

The game ends when the last player finishes the third round. Players count the yields from their gardens and write down the values. There will be as many games as there are players. Finally, the yields from all the player’s games add up.
The player with the most grams wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Space War
Description:
The Space War is a fast-paced strategic 2 player card game with both players playing with the same cards.

Each player represents a selected commander with the goal to destroy the opponents space station while defending their own.

Develop your station to draw more cards, receive more actions points or increase your hand size. Use spaceships, missiles and strategy to win the war.

The cards in your hand can always be played and most of the time each card can be played in several ways.

If your station gets damage you have to flip that many station cards. If you have no station cards left to flip you lose the game.

This game is more about how you play your cards instead of which cards you have.

—description from the designer

Name: Final Girl: Frightmare on Maple Lane
Description:
Final Girl Feature Film Box

Dreams turn deadly when Dr. Fright comes to visit Maple Lane in: Frightmare on Maple Lane. Produced by AJ Porfirio, this Feature Film box stars Dr. Fright, who can kill you in your sleep. Are you brave enough to enter the dreamworld and confront him on his own turf?

The Core Box, when combined with one of our Feature Film Boxes, has everything you need to play the game. Each Feature Film Box features a unique Killer and and iconic Location, and the more Feature Films you have, the more killer/location combinations you can experience!

Each Feature Film Box is double-sided, with amazingly illustrated covers on the front AND back. Not only that, but the magnetically attached box covers are removable, with the reverse of each functioning as the Killer and Location boards respectively.

NOTE: The 2023 First Printing Correction Pack contained 2 corrected cards:

    TERROR - "Marked for Death"
    TERROR - "Blurred Reality"

Name: Confabulation
Description:
The main goal of Confabulation is to score points by spelling words. 
First, a category card is drawn and a category is chosen. This can be done by playing the categories in order, or by rolling a die or otherwise randomly selecting one if just one round is to be played. 
Second, each player is dealt 6 word cards, which have 3x3 grids of letters on them. A timer is set for three minutes. The players will use their own hand of cards to spell words in the selected category until the time runs out. 
The players can rearrange the cards as much as they would like; the cards can be rotated or overlapped. Players write down each word once they find it, then they can rearrange the cards (they don't have to preserve the configuration that allowed them to spell the word). 
When spelling words, any adjacent letters may be used, including diagonally-connected letters (similar to the mechanics of the game Boggle). Letters may only be used once in any given word. 
At the end of the round, points are counted. 3- and 4-letter words are worth one point, 5-letter words are worth 2 points, 6-letter words are worth 3 points, 7-letter words are worth 4 points, etc. 
Plural words do not count unless the word is naturally plural (eg. pants). Spelling the word 'mountains', for example, would count only as the 8-letter word 'mountain'.
Proper nouns DO count if it makes sense in the category. (For example, if the category is 'science terms' then the word 'Einstein' would be allowed).

Players can challenge the spelling of another player's word. If the spelling is incorrect, the word does not count. 
Players can play as many or as few rounds as they want.

Alternative scoring:
Instead of totaling the score of all words at the end of the round, the player who spelled the longest word in the three-minute time period is the winner.

Alternative gameplay:
Players can adjust the number of cards dealt to each player or the amount of time in a round.

—description from the designer

Name: Final Girl: Terror From Above
Description:
Final Girl Vignette

A flock of deadly birds is attacking! Can you save the innocents and survive long enough to escape?

The Vignette requires both the Core Box and one of the Feature Film Boxes to play the game. The Vignette provides the unique Killer and one Final Girl, and the Feature Film Box provides the Location.

In Terror from Above, the birds will be invading the location of your choice. Will the Carnival be suddenly overrun by a flock of birds? Or will Creech Manor be invaded by their overwhelming numbers? Like other killers, you can choose ANY location to play Terror From Above!

NOTE: The 2023 First Printing Correction Pack contained 1 corrected card:

    BLOODLUST CARD

Name: Tropical Tribes
Description:
In Tropical Tribes, you are the chief of a small island tribe, looking to grow to the most mighty tribe in the Pacific. 
It is up to you to collect resources, build new buildings and boats, and go to war with enemy tribes.

Tropical Tribes is a simple roll+write game of tribe building and ocean warfare for 2-4 players.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hero: Tales of the Tomes – Lost Heroics 1
Description:
The once-lost stories of 3 new heroes have been uncovered and will soon be available for you to play. This first expansion to Hero: Tales of the Tomes introduces Briar, Gwendolyn, and Ju'golach to the fray. Each of these heroes offer a fresh and interesting playstyle, taking advantage of the different cards from the deck in never before seen ways.

Each set of Lost Heroics 1 comes with these 3 new heroes.

—description from the designer

Name: Black-Pot
Description:
Black-Pot is played on a board of 109 squares (11x11 with the corners removed) on which players take turns to add tokens of their color, with the object of forming five tokens in a row.

Each square has a number on it and on a player's turn they roll three dice then use the numbers on the dice singly or in combination to determine which squares they may occupy. For example if a player rolls 3–4–6, they may occupy a 13 (3+4+6), or an 18 (3x4+6), or a 12 (3x4) and a 6, or a 7 (3+4) and a 6, or a 3 and a 4 and a 6, or various other combinations.

When a five-in-a-row has been made, the five tokens are removed from the board and the player scores a varying number of points depending on the numbers used in the row — numbers that are more difficult to make score more points and a large bonus is awarded for a row which uses multiple "Black Pot" numbers, which can be made only using all three dice (such as 13, 17, 21).

This game is similar to the publishers' earlier game X-O, but the board is smaller and the scoring is different.

Name: Bad Guy Nonsense
Description:
Bad Guy Nonsense is a unique strategic family card game where you compete to capture fantastical BAD GUYS. It features wild pop culture-rich artwork on large OVERSIZED glossy linen cards making it unlike anything else that has come before.

You’ll need all your wits and gaming skills to employ BOUNTY HUNTERS, BANDITS, BURGLARS, HEROES, MONSTERS, and a WITCH to capture high-value BAD GUY targets. Battle your opponent to steal their captures while defending your own.

The goal of the game is to score points by capturing the most Bad Guy Cards before the deck runs out. You'll need to get the right card combos to make a capture and score points. The higher the value target, the harder the combo is to acquire. You make captures and score points while the SPECIAL CARDS (HEROES, BURGLAR, BANDIT, WITCH, MONSTER) all cause massive havoc between you and your opponent(s). The game gets intense as each turn passes because once the deck runs out, the game is over. When this happens, uncaptured BAD GUYS count as negative points. So you'll want to start discarding them when the deck runs low! However, your opponent(s) may be able to pick them up and use it against you... It's impossible to tell how many turns are left as you don't know how many cards the next player will play!

—description from the designer

Name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Exclusive Queenie 2020: Dice Shrine Chambers
Description:
The dice shrine chambers can be used with the Escape base game (either the original or any of the Big boxes), offering additional challenges. They require the 8 dice from Escape: Roll & Write in order to use them.

During setup, add the dice shrine chambers to the chamber stack and place the 8 dice off to the side. Once a dice shrine chamber is discovered, two of the set-aside dice are rolled and placed on the shrines in the chamber. Adventurers in the chamber can use the indicated number of dice that match the face shown on the die in the shrine to activate the shrine, gaining the bonus shown on the shrine, then the die is removed. The bonuses are: a gem, movement to an adjacent room without requiring the matching dice symbols, a treasure, rerolling all players' cursed dice, or keeping the die from the shrine as an extra die.

The dice shrine chambers can be used with any combination of expansions or Queenies.

Name: Logitac
Description:
A chess-style abstract strategy game played on a pyramid of four boards: 12x12, 8x8, 5x5 and 1x1. Each player has a pyramid (king), a cube (rook), a cylinder (bishop), a double-pawn (knight) and 44 pawns, and the winner is the player whose pyramid ascends to the fourth (1x1) board.

The game starts with each player's pyramid, cube, cylinder and 12 pawns arranged on the first (12x12) board; the remaining 32 pawns and the double-pawn start off the board and can be introduced on the owning player's back rank in lieu of a move. A player's piece can ascend to a higher board only when two pawns or one major piece belonging to that player have been captured. Otherwise pieces move approximately as their chess equivalents, although pawns gain the ability to move in more directions when they ascend to smaller boards.

Name: Tiny Epic Pirates: Deluxe Edition
Description:
Tiny Epic Pirates is a 45 minute, 1-4 player game of high-seas adventure, utilizing a variable rondel action system and action combo-ing!  In Tiny Epic Pirates you take control of a Pirate ship with the goal of burying vast amounts of wealth on secret island hideaways.

Each turn, you move your Captain Token around your ship’s action wheel (rondel), selecting which action to perform... Plunder, Trade, Crew Up, Attack, or Search. Each player has a randomized and unique arrangement of these actions on their rondel. Sailing your Pirate Ship is something every player can do every time they take an action.

Plundering allows you to acquire booty from settlements at a very reasonable rate. It’s amazing how negotiating changes when your blunderbuss is at the ready. A crate of gunpowder for a promise of no harm? Fair exchange. Trading allows you to sell your ill-gotten goods to the Black Market for gold. Each Market is only interested in a specific good, so make sure you are sailing in the right direction. Timing is everything, sell your good at the wrong time and it’s worth a pittance. Crew Up adds a new crew member to your growing Pirate Ship. Crew increases your ship’s combat advantage and unlocks new abilities for each spoke of your ship’s action wheel, making that action more powerful every time you take it! Attacking Merchant Ships and other Pirates will grow your reputation. It also happens to be a great way to score some gold and more booty to sell. Be enough of a menace and you may just become a Legend of the Sea!

Search the high-seas for treasures left behind by the unfortunate souls that preceded you. Salvage old ship parts for temporary aid or get lucky and find something worth selling.

The end of the game is triggered once a player has buried three treasures. To do this, a player must first acquire the amount of gold required to bury at the various bury spots on the map. After all players have had an equal number of turns. The player who has buried three treasures wins the game. Ties are decided by the player who has the highest legendary status, followed by which player has the most gold.

Includes the Crimson Silver Mini-Expansion.

--description from the publisher
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: Yotal
Description:
An abstract strategy game somewhat resembling checkers: each player has 20 pieces and the winner is the player who gets more of their pieces to the far side of the board. On their turn each player moves one of their pieces to an adjacent space, or captures an opposing piece on an adjacent space.

The board is a tessellation of 188 triangles, and the unique factor of the game is that each space of the board is coloured one of five colors (red, orange, yellow, green, purple) and each piece can only enter three of the five colors.

Name: 7 Wonders Duel: Solo
Description:
Home alone?
No opponents available to play 7 Wonder Duel with you?
Or maybe your partner / companion beats you every time?

With our editor, Repos Production, Antoine and I have created this mini expansion of 7 Wonders Duel, which allows you to play the game SOLO, facing one of the 5 charismatic leaders.

How does it work?

Gameplay is simple:

     Choose or randomly draw the Leader you will face
     Each turn, turn over one of the 12 Decision Cards and follow the instructions
     The Leader will build the selected card, regardless of whether they have the resources or not. (After all, they are Leaders, they have many privileges) – Sometimes, the Leader will even play twice in a row
     Each of the Decision cards indicates the Leader’s choice priorities, as well as the possibility of immediately replaying an additional round.


When we say it is simple, we just mean the rules – not the strategy.
We are just talking about learning the rules, and managing the game elements during the game. We would never have made a solo mode in the “gas factory » style, as is often the case with solo adaptations ?.

To be successful, you need to adapt to the strategy of your virtual opponents, and it will not be Byzantium every day (as Hammurabi said).

—description from the designer

Name: Diadochi Naval Rules
Description:
Diadochi Naval Rules is a simple set of naval miniatures rules for fleet battles in the Diadochi (Alexandrian Successors) period.

Each side in the battle should consist of squadrons of 8 or more ships. 
Ideally, an individual player should command each squadron. 
A flagship is designated for each squadron.
Players secretly plot their initial locations on a sketch of the battle area, indicating formation, spacing and locations of flagships.

Scale:
40mm = 1 cable (607.56 ft), or 1:4630. 
Designed for 1:1200 miniatures.

TURN SEQUENCE
1. First side command roll(s)
2. First side movement phase
3. First side missile fire
4. First side combat phase
5. Second side command roll(s)
6. Second side movement phase
7. Second side missile fire
8. Second side combat phase

—description from the designer + rules
Families: History: Wars of the Diadochi and Syrian Wars

Name: Battlespace: Ultra Modern Solo Skirmish Game
Description:
Battlespace is an Ultra Modern military tabletop solo (or cooperative) game.

The player(s) selects 4 pre-made soldiers (a battle card each, containing all the information needed) for his team.
The simple AI directs the opposition, by drawing cards and acting accordingly.

Turns are divided in 3 phases.

Winning is conditioned by succeeding the mission.

Name: Dragon Scary-go-round
Description:
This is a fun cooperative game in which archers work together to defeat the circling dragon, while avoiding the ghosts. 
Reduce the dragon's life to zero before it injures an archer or your run out of time, and your archers will be victorious.
Watch out for the ghosts, if they grab all the archers, that may spell your doom.

How to play
Decide which one of your action card to play to determine the sequence of events. 
If you can, grab a book of magic spells to help your archer group out.  
With your friends work together to setup your archers so they may attack the dragon at the beginning of the next turn.
If the ghost appears, move the ghosts according to their speed and dice roll. Try not to get caught.

The game is full of choices for the player to make. Choose the right choices to lead your group to success.
Will you let the dragon move first or will you move first to avoid the ghosts?

—description from the designer

Name: Heroes Among Us
Description:
Heroes Among Us is a simplistic rule set design to give players a fast pace superhero skirmish game using any miniatures in their collection.

Played on a 2' x 2' table with players fielding 3 - 5, 28mm miniatures per side.

You will need to download the Abilities Chart to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Heroes Among Us: Villains Among Us
Description:
Villains Among Us A supplement for Heroes Among Us

Introduces campaign play to Heroes Among Us. Players will take control of a team of super powered beings and battle across a short campaign to see who will come out on top and save or rule Arch City.

In Villains Among Us, players now take part in scenarios to earn VP (victory points) to win the overall campaign. One player will take control of the villains, while the other player represents the heroes.

You will need a copy of the HAU core rules to use this book.

—description from the publisher
